required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neuraxial Preservative Free Morphine for Normal Spontaneous Vaginal Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Neuraxial Preservative Free Morphine for Normal Spontaneous Vaginal Delivery: A Prospective Double Blind Randomized Control Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

clinical_study.source: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

brief_summary.textblock: Patients presenting for normal spontaneous vaginal delivery who have a neuraxial anesthestic will be randomized to receive preservative free morphine or saline placebo after delivery.

detailed_description.textblock: After obtaining consent, women presenting to the labor floor at Mount Sinai Hospital will be randomized into two groups, intervention and placebo. Baseline demographic data and surveys in regards to postpartum depression, anxiety, breastfeed willingness and pain scores will be obtained. After delivery of the baby patients will either receive 2mg preservative free morphine or saline via the epidural catheter prior to its removal. The study team will then record pain and recovery scores, as well as follow up screens to the aforementioned endpoints. The study will end at the 6 week postpartum visit with the patient's obstetrician.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The only individual that will know to which group the patient was assigned is the individual on the study team who is drawing up the medication. This individual will have no other role in the assessment or evaluation of the patient.

primary_outcome.description: Quantity of opioid used in 24 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Pain Score: Likert full scale 1-10, with higher score indicating more pain
OBSQ10 total score 0-100, with higher score indicating better health status
The Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) is a 10-item instrument to assess postpartum depression, with total score from 0-30. Higher score indicates more depressed symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with breast feeding success
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will respond yes/no as to their breast feeding success and continuation

intervention.description: After delivery of the baby patients will receive via the epidural catheter prior to its removal.
After delivery of the baby patients will receive via the epidural catheter prior to its removal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women in labor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not a candidate for neuraxial anesthesia
- Patient refusal
- Allergy to morphine
- Patients with chronic pain syndromes

overall_official.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
